alert.note: Alert for La Paz; Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued June 25 at 7:03PM MST until June 25 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Southwestern La Paz County in west central Arizona... Central Yuma County in southwestern Arizona... * Until 800 PM MST. * At 703 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 18 miles southeast of Yuma Proving Ground to 10 miles west of Tyson to near Tacna to near Mohawk, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 15 and 62. AZ Route 95 between mile markers 36 and 60. Locations impacted include... Fortuna Foothills, Wellton, Tacna, Tyson, Kinter, Ligurta, Mohawk and Roll. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! Strong to severe thunderstorms are also possible behind this wall of dust. Keep updated with this quickly evolving situation.
